name: Wall Drills
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and at least 12 inches away from the wall.
2. Slowly slide your back down the wall, keeping your shoulders, ears, and buttocks aligned, until you're in a squatting position.
3. Hold this position for a brief moment to ensure proper alignment and engage your core muscles (if needed, use a mirror to correct form).
4. Push back up against the wall, extending your hips and legs fully into standing position.
5. Repeat this up-and-down motion multiple times for increased range of motion, strength development, and flexibility, but avoid bouncing or over-pressing yourself.
6. Take breaks as necessary between repetitions and consider adding variations (such as shuffling, crossing one foot in front of the other, etc.) to make the movement more engaging.
short_summary: Wall drills involve sliding back against a wall or stationary object while keeping proper form and alignment to develop strength and improve mobility.
equipment_used: Wall or stationary object for support
